chinese: 老耿端起枪，眯缝起一只三角眼，一搂扳机响了枪，冰雹般的金麻雀劈哩啪啦往下落，铁砂子在柳枝间飞迸着，嚓嚓有声。
english: Old Geng picked up his shotgun, squinted, and pulled the trigger. Two sparrows crashed to the ground like hailstones as shotgun pellets tore noisily through the branches.

The bullets flew across the branches of the trees like cannonballs, cracking and clinking with a loud sound.

chinese: 次日天未明时，刘老老便起来梳洗了， 又将板儿教了几句话； 五六岁的孩子，听见带了他进城逛去，喜欢的无不应承。
english: Next day Grannie Liu was up before dawn. chinese: 钱老板道：“是，是，多谢香主。” 在一张椅上坐了，续道：“属下将小郡主藏在猪肚里带进宫来，一来是为瞒过宫门侍卫的重重搜检，二来是要瞒过沐王府众人的耳目。
english: 'Thank you, Master,' said Butcher Qian, seating himself in one of the chairs and continuing. 'There were really two reasons why I hid the Little Countessinside this pig's carcass. Any more, sir,' said the butcher. He sat down on a chair and began his account. chinese: 夫妻二人半世只生此女，一旦失去，何等烦恼，因此昼夜啼哭，几乎不顾性命。 看看一月，士隐已先得病，夫人封氏也因思女构疾，日日请医问卦。
english: The shock of so sudden a loss to a middle-aged couple who had only ever had the one daughter can be imagined. In tears every day and most of the night, they almost lost the will to go on living, and after about a month like this first Shi-yin and then his wife fell ill, so that doctors and diviners were in daily attendance on them.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Half a century ago, they had a daughter. But now if this becomes their only child, what kind of trouble would it cause? So every day they weep for her in the morning and at night, even disregarding their lives. Look at one month, Master Su’ang is already ill with illness, and Miss Fang also has thought of bringing her to see a doctor and consult her.

In these early days before their marriage her offspring had just been born. At the time the present balance of life was岌岌有危，然而自此至今日夜不停不止的哭诉，一直到了士隐不在了之后，女儿已经名正言顺、寄胎在府上；至于妻母何者可忍, 而如何能令二老受苦? 他们每日夜班地去请大夫作诊，家中的琐事也都全权由庶子带路去说理。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: A couple married for half a lifetime had one daughter, and when they lost her, how much trouble they would have! They would weep day and night, almost losing their lives. After a month, Mr. Xing was already ill, and Lady Shen also became sick because of thinking about her daughter.

The husband and wife had now reached their middle twenties and were still the rightful owners of a little girl; the thought of parting with her at any stage caused them such sorrow that they were weeping for almost every day. The older of these months was so young that it was already apparent to those looking after him that he was seriously ill. The younger was so ill that his wife fell ill too, because she could not bear the sight of the two of them grieving for their lost child.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The two husbands had been together for half a century and gave birth to this daughter, but if they lose her now, what a problem would it be? Therefore, they cry every night, even though they don’t want their lives. unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Living together for so many years, both parents had brought their children into the world; then, too, too soon, as the child grew older, this female child of theirs disappeared. Unforeseeable as it may be, these parents had abandoned the cause of their dying love; day after day they pleaded with their doctors to diagnose their sickness and prophecy their illness with fauches of pain.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The husband and wife had only one daughter for half a lifetime; when they lost her, how much trouble! Therefore, they were crying day and night, almost不顾命地求医问药。 After one month, Mr. Xindie had already got ill, and his wife, Mrs. Seol, was also suffering from a disease because of thinking about their daughter.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The father and mother of this child had spent all their youth and early maturity nurturing her in their home; now, suddenly freed from this burden, they were plunged into its aftermath. chinese: 虽然我奶奶与他已经在高粱地里凤凰和谐，在那个半是痛苦半是幸福的庄严过程中，我奶奶虽然也怀上了我的功罪参半但毕竟是高密东北乡一代风流的父亲，但那时奶奶是单家的明媒正娶的媳妇，爷爷与她总归是桑间濮上之合，带着相当程度的随意性偶然性不稳定性，况且我父亲也没落土，所以，写到那时候的事，我还是称呼他余占鳌更为准确。

So she and Granddad were adulterers, their relationship marked by measures of spontaneity, chance, and uncertainty. And since Father wasn't born while they were together, accuracy demands that I refer to Granddad as Yu Zhan'ao in writing about this period.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Although my grandmother is also a harmonious couple with him on his side of the rice field, and in that solemn and solemn period where they were both sorrowful and happy together, I do not have any charge, but it was indeed a proud father of the highland East of the Northern Plains, but then it was just a single man's marriage ceremony as a wedding partner, and there was quite a degree of randomness and instability. Moreover, I did not come from soil yet, so I called him "Luo Xue Qing" more accurately when writing about the things at that time.

Even though my grandma had already been blossoming in the sorghum fields under the direction of her father, who was a single man from Northeast Gaomi Township, where she was a married man who at once shared pain with me and at the same time compensated Granddad for his crime, she still held a certain elegance and refined refinement in those highland northeast villages where, when the soil rested on her head, she was a married wife who, having been adopted, felt at once relief and annoyance toward my grandfather. Also, despite the fact that he hadn't born any children, by which time it was already possible to call him Cousin Amtu more appropriately.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Although my grandmother had been harmoniously married with him in the field of corn, she was still happily pregnant at that time, but despite her being a half-dirty, half-fortunate father, I should call her a single house wife who was engaged in marriage by the family. My grandfather had been married to her as well, so it was not very stable or fixed, and even though my father hadn’t fallen off the earth yet, I shouldn’t use his name.

Even though Grandma had consummated her love for Yu Cang in the sorghum field, reaching harmony and happiness, she remained a half-crazed, half-cursed child born of a father who walked among the gourd fields of Northeast Gaomi Township — a man who, like his father before him, had been tied to his wife and loved unconditionally. But Grandma was not a virgin; she had not fallen into debt to society. So, even when it came time to write about this period in her life, I called her by the name of her father, Yu Cang.

chinese: 他们杀人越货，精忠报国，他们演出过一幕幕英勇悲壮的舞剧，使我们这些活着的不肖子孙相形见绌，在进步的同时，我真切地感到种的退化。
english: They killed, they looted, and they defended their country in a valiant, stirring ballet that makes us unfilial descendants who now occupy the land pale by comparison. Surrounded by progress, I feel a nagging sense of our species' regression.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: They murder and rob, but they perform heroic dramas for their country, making us, living sinners, look inferior. At the same time, I feel that we are regressing.

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: They kill for money, brave their hearts, they have performed arias that make us all look like we're second-rate, while we progress, I feel like I'm losing my way.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: They have committed hisinous crimes and have continued to perform magnificent ballets, painting their name among those who come before modern times. unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: They murder and rob, serving their country faithfully; they have performed a series of heroic tragedies which make us, who live today, seem contemptible. At the same time, I feel my own decline, not just that of society, but also that of myself.

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: They commit murder after murder, and serve as a national hero, they have produced plays that make us feel inferior, but I am truly feeling this degradation.

Good fellow!' said Xue Pan, 'I was just hoping to persuade you not to hold a grudge against me for forgetting this taboo tomorrow when we meet; so I won't mind if you have to deceive me.'

chinese: 他一改往常在媒体上那副脏兮兮的流浪汉模样，西装革履，显得风度翩翩，“你们和我想象的差不多，都是精英人士，《三体》就是为你们这样的阶层准备的，它的内涵和意境，常人难以理解；玩它所需要的知识，其层次之高，内容之深，也是常人不可能具备的。”
english: Appearing in the media, he usually looked disheveled, like a vagrant, but today, he was dressed sharply in a suit and dress shoes. 'You're just like I imagined. Three Body is intended for people in your class because the common crowd cannot appreciate its meaning and mood. To play it well requires knowledge and understanding that ordinary people do not possess.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: He changed his image on the media and wore a suit, appearing refined and handsome. He was "as you imagine it" - that is, he was elite and well-respected; its contents and essence were common knowledge for most people; but the level of knowledge required to understand it was too low.

Instead, he adopted a refined air of propriety that didn't look dirty but clean-lined and fashionable. 'You're not different from the people on Three Body All Born To Live In The Real World,' he said. 'We aren't like the ordinary people; we're top-class individuals. Three Body isn't only for those who know about scientific facts and mathematics—being able to understand concepts at that sublimacy of knowledge requires a true genius.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: He had changed his usual dirty homeless man look on TV, now he was dressed up in a suit, looking elegant, "We are similar to you guys, we are all elites. ‘Three body’ is for your kind of people. Its contents and意境, ordinary people can’t understand; knowledge needed to play it is at a high level and its depth is also beyond what common people could have."

He changed back to a clean-shaven street bum as usual, but this time with a difference: a suit and tie. His new appearance gave him a refined air. unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Little Red heard that Xiao Hong looked out of her window and saw a little girl from the courtyard. She replied, "I'm at home, come in."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Crimson looked out through the window and identified the girl as one of the servants working in her courtyard: 'I'm in here at present, but if you come in, just say!'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The little red heard that her mother was sitting in the window seat watching her from behind. She then said, "In the house."

chinese: 等我来再走。”
english: You can go when I come for you.'

I'll go again soon enough on my own.'

chinese: 我和陈清扬在饭店里敦伟大友谊，是娱乐性的。
english: The strengthening of our great friendship that Chen Qingyang and I did while in the hotel room was of the recreational sort.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: I have been deeply entwined with Chen Quanjun at a restaurant, which is just for entertainment purposes.
Chen Qingyang and I drank big cups of friendship in the hotel room, enjoying the entertainment of the place.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: I had a great friendship with Chen Qingyang at the restaurant, which was for entertainment.
When Chen Qingyang and I bonded over our great friendship in the hotel room, it was mostly for entertainment.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: And I had great friendship with Chen Chuangyang in a restaurant, which is playful.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Chen Qingyang and I drank great wine in our room to renew our great friendship, which was celebratory.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: I have a big friendship with Chen Qingyang at the restaurant, which is just for fun.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: When Chen Qingyang and I built up our great friendship in hotel rooms, it was part entertainment.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: I and Chen Qingyuan in a restaurant have great friendship, it's pleasurable.

chinese: 贾蔷翻身出来，纸笔现成，拿来叫贾瑞写。 他两个做好做歹，只写了五十两银子，画了押，贾蔷收起来。 然后撕掳贾蓉。
english: Jia Qiang at once disappeared and reappeared only a moment later with paper and a writing-brush which had evidently been made ready in advance. Writing at his dictation Jia Rui was compelled, in spite of protests, to put down fifty taels of silver as the amount on the IOU. The document, having been duly signed, was at once pocketed by Jia Qiang, who then pretended to seek the connivance of Jia Rong.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Jiā yé yīn qǐ chū, zǎo bǎ sì chéng, lái kàn jiē qù ào zhě, wò jǐ yǒu ào zhú. Yī kǔ bǎ wài tā yào cǐ xíng chēng. Wà bǎ xià cǐ yǒu ào zhú, zài 502 nán yǔ shì diǎnr, huà xiàng pèng, jiǎng yǐ xiù. Jiǎng yè qǔ qiú. Jiǎng yè fēng. Shì tàn qīng jiǎo.

He jumped up when Jia Qiang's body came滚了过来，并且趁他不动时抓来文房山儿，拿他写的一张“硅石”三个字说:「借二十两钱玩儿！」 那贾瑞便拿笔在纸上画了个「回环」 two words at the end of it, then took the paper together with him, for he had been afraid that Jia Qiang might repeat it again. He then drew a 'loop' on the other side of which he said he would lend the other three words to use as he pleased. Jia Qiang received his papers by turning them over on a sheet of paper and holding them up like this: 'I've borrowed twenty taels of silver to spend a while at Green Delights. I'll spend the rest here.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Jia Rui got up and wrote out paper and ink. He wrote a hundred pieces of silver on it. He signed his name with his father’s name and sealed the document. Jia Rui took it away. Then he tore up Jia Rong.

When Jia Qiang threw himself from the bed, papers were already ready at his feet, so Jia Rui proceeded to make his bargain as follows: Fifty taels of silver and two drawings of a handprint on the promissory note would constitute his payment. He and Jia Rong then tore up the paper to prevent Jia Lin from seeing what had happened.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Jiāyǐ yìǎn bù xià gǔ, fàng sòng zhú zhī kě yǐ cháng, wò jiàn zhào zài qí lái zuǒ yǐ yǔ líng lóng cì. Yè hǎo ào dōu yǔ mǎn ài, zhěng niàn shì yǔ liǎng rán yǔ. Wéi zhì zhū yǔ jìn yǔ, biàn néng yǐ yǔ líng lóng cì, tóu yǔ píng. unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: He rose up abruptly and gave chase to his handkerchief, which fluttered in his hand, and picked up a total of fifty cash. He took this, together with the indentifications, and drew them on. Then he tore out both of Jia Rui's papers.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Jia Rui got up and took out a piece of paper and pen. He handed them to Jia Rong and asked him to write something. They made no progress at all. In the end, they wrote fifty two pieces of silver and drew a bond. Then, he threw away Jia Rong.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Autumn in August brought fire and blood to the immeasurable fields of sorghum, turning it a radiant red; in contrast, the stalks looked lost and charming.

chinese: 这些人嘴里尊称自己是香主，满口什么静候香主吩咐云云，其实各人肚里早就有了主意，只盼得到自己赞同，于是一切便推在韦香主头上，日后他们就不会担当重大干系。
english: It was all 'Master this' and 'Master that' and respectfully waiting to be told by the Master what they should do; but invariably they had already decided what they wanted to do and only wanted the Master's approval for doing it, so that if there was any question about it later, the Master would have sole responsibility for what they had done.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The people who claim they are the "Master of香气" are simply making up their own nonsense by saying things like "We have no idea what your will is, but we must obey it". The real reason behind this is that each person already has a plan of action inside their minds. They just hope for someone to agree with them, so they do everything under the nose of the "Master of香气". In the future, they won't be involved in important matters at all.

It is their elders who stand as祭司口头的神甫, who tell us what to do in accordance with his commands. But all along the way the boys have been默守其政, silently determining what they really wish from him—and all the while they have been secretly preparing their own replies should their master decide. By which time it is too late for them to appeal to him; and they simply let it drop, knowing that he shall now be the centre of every discussion.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: These people, who call themselves "masters" and say such things as "waiting for a master's orders", really have their own minds already. They just want to get their approval so that they can avoid any major responsibilities. Therefore, once these people are blamed, they will not be held responsible at all.

These eunuchs talk with their mouths about how they await their master's instructions; but deep down they all have their own ideas and are merely waiting for Trinket to give them an order. Once he is satisfied, all responsibility for the actions that will follow falls on Trinket. From then on it is up to him how far they go.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: These people boast that they are the custodians of a sacred flame, promising that any advice will be given by their master without delay. However, the truth is that each one has already had his or her own plans in mind, hoping for approval from their master. Therefore, all these things were put on their shoulders, and eventually they would not have a major role to play.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: It is the same with the people speaking of their Master. All they say when anyone else asks them what their instructions are are 'May I have your services?'—'I expect you will give me such and such a order.' But all they imply inwardly is, 'I wish I were your Comrade-remain unimproviated.' They have already long formed their own opinions about who their task was and what lay ahead of them. They merely hope that their master will agree with them—and this greatly depends on their agreeing． . . . In the end it is the individual who endorses Whiskers who carries on the business of transporting the Prince to his quarters—that is, to speak frankly—a task which involves no great importance, and who therefore takes no credit for himself at all.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: These people spoke of themselves as the Master of Incense when they were speaking with their mouths full, saying things like "waiting for a master's orders." In fact, each had already made up his mind. He just wanted to get it approved by the Master of Incense so that he would not be held responsible for any major issues later on.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: These eunuchs always refer to themselves as 'Aroma Main Man' and, whenever they talk about waiting for their master's instructions, are thinking up all sorts of things to do while he is away. All they want is for him to agree to be their mistress, and then all manner of mischief they could get up would be shifted on to someone else's conscience -- yours, Master, in this case.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The people who speak of themselves as the Master of the香气， talk about what they should be waiting for from the香气 Master's orders; in fact, each person has already got a plan in his or her mind, just hoping that he or she will get approval from the香气 Master, so that one day they won’t have any major responsibility.

chinese: 彼此的梦里都做过无数回，那梦里的人都不大像了，还不如不梦见。
english: They had appeared in each other's dreams, but the images in their dreams were so far from the real person that they would have been better off not even dreaming.

In their dreams they did it countless times; but by the time the last dream was over, they were no longer even vaguely like each other—not worth having dreams of, in fact.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Both of us have done countless dreams together, but the people we dream about aren't exactly the same. Why not not dream at all?
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Both of them had made countless dreams in which they acted out scenes from原著小说， but those dreams were no longer like each other; it was even harder to imagine them waking up.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: They had done it countless times, but by the time they went to sleep each one of them dreamed about everyone else—except themselves. It was a dream where nobody looked like anyone else, which ended up being closer to reality than any of them had imagined.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Each dream had been doing countless things to them, but the people who did not seem like them were much less than what they had done.

chinese: 宝玉见他星眼微饧，香腮带赤，不觉神魂早荡，一歪身坐在椅子上，笑道：“你才说什么？”
english: At the sight of those soft cheeks so adorably flushed and the starry eyes a little misted with sleep a wave of emotion passed over him. He sank into a chair and smiled back at her: 'What was that you were saying just now before I came in?'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Zao Guojin saw him gaze cloudy eyes, with red on his cheeks, and didn't feel that his mind had been swept away by his words earlier. He turned round and said: 'What did you say?"

But all at once Bao-yu realises that during these fleeting moments of lucidity his old friend has changed from a full-grown young man to an untanned, sun-baked little girl. His own concerns were distracted, and he sits back on the chair, smirking at Shi-feng. 'What is it?' he asks her.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Baoyu saw his star eyes half closed and his red cheeks. He was instantly drawn in by her beauty. He leaned forward and asked, "What did you say?"

When she saw the faintness of his starry eyes and the slight pinkness of her cheek he began to lose his senses and, without being told, sat on the chair next to hers and guffawed: 'What are you doing?'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: By the way, what did you say?"
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: has for knowledge of the trade. She was sitting on the other side of the chair, very far from where he was, and gave him a little smile through the tights: 'What're you talking about?'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Baoyu saw his star eyes were slightly dilated, his cheeks flushed, and he couldn’t help being drawn into a state of dizziness. He leaned on the chair and said, "What did you just say?"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: When he saw her eyes blinking slowly and her cheeks blushing a little, his imagination began to run wild and he sat down without being invited and gazed at her mesmerised. 'What do you mean?' he said, when she had stopped speaking.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Jiāng niàn jiàn yī shēn jǐ wǔ mào gū kòng, xiōng pà bǎo sù, fàng qì hěn chèng, ài ài tā zài xíng zhǒng zuò jiào, dì miàn suì sì xī yǐ tiào lǎo dié, wú qū qīng sì yǐ tīng liáo."

chinese: 夹竹桃也开了。 平安里也是有几棵夹竹桃的，栽在晒台上碎砖围起来的一掬泥土中，开出绚烂的花朵。
english: Before long, the oleanders, planted haphazardly in makeshift planters formed from broken bricks on balconies, put forth their dazzling flowers.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: A petunia blooms too. The Peace Village has a few of them as well, planted on top of broken bricks scattered about in the pebbles of a sitting room. It is a beautiful flower.
As for the foxglooms, some of them were seen around Peace Lane, blooming in the sunlight hanging on scattered bricks and gravel.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The jasmine is also blooming. There are a few jasmines in Peaceful Lane too; they are planted in a small patch of soil surrounded by broken bricks on the veranda.
Clematis also bloomed on Peace Lane; a small patch of them was grown around the top of the staircase in the area below the balcony where Wang Qiyao practiced climbing.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The same is true of the flowers on the tree in Peace Village. There are a few in the garden of Peace Village planted in a pebbled soil scattered around by broken bricks. The blossoms were so beautiful that they could be seen from far away.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: As for the foxglove, it opened up this weekend, adding a touch of color to the quiet streets of Peace Lane.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Peaceful Street also has a few camellias, planted in a handful of dirt around the patio bricks, and they bloom with brilliant colors.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Clematis also grew in Peace Lane. There were a few clumps of Clematis planted around the balcony bricks on which they had cultivated their gardens.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The flowers of the bamboo plant were also blooming. The place where the park was planted with a bamboo plant was also covered with small pieces of cement that made it look like a bench. The blossoms were so beautiful that they could make people feel happy.

chinese: 雨打倒了无数的高粱，雨在田野里狂欢，蛤蟆躲在高粱根下，哈达哈达地抖着颌下雪白的皮肤； 狐狸蹲在幽暗的洞里，看着从高粱上飞溅而下的细小水珠，道路很快就泥泞不堪，杂草伏地，矢车菊清醒地擎着湿漉漉的头。
english: Sorghum crumpled under the wild rain. Toads took refuge under the stalks, their white pouches popping in and out noisily; foxes hid in their darkened dens to watch tiny drops of water splashing down from the sorghum plants.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The rain destroyed countless high粱， it played a drunken game of life on the fields. The harpy was hiding under the stalks of the tall beans， his face snow-white as he let out the small drops of water that were shot up by the clouds. The dew covered its path， making mud slippery and tangled. The fox sat inside the dimly-lit hole， looking at the falling drops from the beans as they fell like tiny specks of snow. The tulip bush had been standing upright when it woke up and was now dripping wet with a wetting head.

Every stalk of sorghum was struck by a storm of rain, and to hide from the reveling water, Toads hiding under the roots scolded white sandy plains. foxes huddled in dark burrows, watching with interest the small drops streaking down from the stalks, the path soon becomes caked in mud, thistle clings to the dried-out head. The cornflowers stand up, their heads drenched by wet whisks.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The rain beat down on countless corn stalks, raining down in the fields, frogs hiding in the roots of the corn, shaking their white skin with a dance; foxes huddled in the dark cave, watching the tiny drops that fell from the corn stalks, soon making the road muddy, weeds lying flat, daisies awake holding wet heads.

The rain beats against countless sorghum stalks, causing them to sway back and forth in the field; the frogs hide under the sorghum roots, wriggling their white, snowy skin until it shines like a rainbow. The fox crouches in a dark cave, watching the tiny drops of water fly midair. In no time at all the path becomes muddied, the grass bent over, and the bitz flower stands up calmly amid the wet foliage.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The rain destroyed countless high粱， the rains danced on the fields， the babbler hiding under the stalks of the corn as he laughed as the hailstones pattered down; the fox sat low in the dark cave， looking at the falling drops of water from the corn stalks， the roads were muddy and grass grew thick around， the tulip was sweating from the dew．
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Millions of sorghum bodies fell to the ground, each one shaking itself with each gust of wind. To hide from the rain, foxes hopped under the roots, but white dogs lay洁白的皮毛在灯影中白色的道路之上; clumps of ivy stood up, their wet heads gazing down at the water spattered by飞扬的细小水滴。 The path was caked with mud, and reeds bent over their feet, the cornflower heads of the last bushes shining in the mist.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Raindrops smashed countless ears of corn; rain danced in the fields; frogs hid under the roots of corn stalks; foxes crouched in a dark cave watching the tiny drops falling from the ears of corn on the stalks; soon the road became muddy with weeds lying down; the asters were awake and holding their heads wetly.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Crops of sorghum were beaten down by rain; Whiskers, the frog from the field, wriggled under the crops, wringing out white skin from a snow-white jaw; Squirrels hid in the roots of sorghum; a muddy path formed in the rain. Blossoms from the sunflower plant stood up straight in the air, over which drizzling rain fell.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The rains have destroyed countless high-corn fields, and the fields are jubilantly playing at night, the cockroaches hiding under the stalks of the corn. The foxes sit quietly in the dimly-lit caves, watching as the raindrops fall from the tall stalks of the corn. Roads soon become muddy, the grass covering the ground with patches of yellow and black, and the flowers of the zizai were standing upright, their leaves wet and limp.

chinese: 那刘老老先听见告艰苦，只当是没想头了， 又听见给他二十两银子，喜的眉开眼笑道：“我们也知道艰难的，但只俗语说的：‘瘦死的骆驼比马还大’呢。
english: When Grannie Liu heard Xi-feng talk about 'difficulties' she concluded that there was no hope. Her delight and the way in which her face lit up with pleasure when she heard that she was, after all, to be given twenty taels of silver can be imagined. 'We knew you had your troubles,' she said, 'but as the saying goes, 'A starved camel is bigger than a fat horse.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: That's what Liu old man told him first. He thought he was thinking of his own thoughts; then he heard that he got twenty pieces of silver for him, and laughed happily: "We know how hard it is, but just from what I've learned from my mother tongue 'soreness' is also a sign of suffering."

At the time their little presence was unknown to him, but as he listened more and more they became increasingly anxious: it was as if every word he said were weighing on his soul. 'I know how hard it is,' he thought. 'But according to the saying 'fat birds are greater than horses' . .'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Tao Lao was first struck by the hardships, thinking that he had lost his mind, hearing him give him twenty gold pieces, he burst out laughing and said, "We also know difficulties, but the saying goes, 'a skinny camel is as big as a horse'."
At first Mo爹听到这女孩说起难处时还把她当作没有听出话来，直到Twenty唐拿出二十两银子给他说的时候，他才又惊又喜地睁开眼睛笑眯眯地说起来：「听人常说‘肥猪八两卖不穷’，如今我们二两银子也有人给，也算得是‘瘦死的骆驼比马大’吧！」
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: That's why Liu Geangang was surprised at hearing that he was in trouble, thinking it was a joke, but then heard him give him two shillings and said, "We know what hard times are, but just as old people used to say: 'a cow with no head is more important than a horse.'"
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: At a certain point on he gave in to sarcasm, understanding that by 'sacred saying' he was referring to the old book of use which says: 'To him who has many troubles in life, the devil is not far off even in size'.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Mr Liu heard that it was difficult. He thought this was just a joke. Hearing that he would receive 20 lians of silver, he burst out laughing and said: "We also know how hard things can get, but the saying goes 'a lean camel is as big as a horse'."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: First hearing this, Grannie Liu had assumed that the same old story did not apply to them (they had yet to be informed that they were to receive a twenty-crown bonus), but upon being told that it was twenty-counsels he was to have, she had allowed her eyes to narrow up and her smile to brighten: 'How true,' she said to Bao-yu, 'that say of the fat horse and the thin camel!
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: That Liu's old man heard that he was hard of heart, thinking it was no big deal; but then he heard that he received twenty two shillings, with a smile on his face: "We know how tough it is, but just from what we learned in our days, 'the fat can't be compared to a horse'."

chinese: 她有一次夜半被叫醒。 人们早已入睡，那叫声便显得格外惊动，带着些危急和恐怖。 王琦瑶的心擂鼓似的怦怦响着，她睡衣外面披上件夹袄便下楼去开门，见是两个乡下人，抬了一个担架，躺着垂危的病人，说是请王医师救命。
english: Once, awakened in the middle of the night by urgent and frightened calls for help at the door, she threw a jacket over her nightgown and rushed downstairs, her heart pounding, to find two men from the provinces carrying someone on a stretcher. The person was critically ill.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Once upon a time, she was woken up at midnight by someone calling out, with some of her heart pounding as it did so. The sound was especially alarming and ominous. Wang Qiara's heart pounded in her chest, and she slipped on the clothes that had been thrown over her shoulders, leaving her to go downstairs and open the door, seeing two farmers, one carrying a stretcher, lying on lifeless patients. They were asking for her help to save their lives.

One time she was woken by someone late in the night. The people there were already asleep by the time she had registered for the wake-up call. The noise was scary and alarming, and Wang Qiyao felt a pounding heart that sent her to the floor. She just下了楼，发现两个本地人躺在病人身边，说王文波大夫正在救他命。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: She was woken at midnight by a call. The voices were so alarming that they seemed to come from far away. Wang Qiaoli's heart pounded as she dressed for bed. She put on a jacket and went downstairs. She saw two farmers carrying a stretcher. There was a sick patient lying there, asking for help from Dr. Wang.

One night, suddenly disturbed by a call, she woke up halfway through sleep. The sound of someone else's breathing awakened her and frightened her. She could feel her heart racing as she got out of bed and put on a sweater. Two country folks were standing outside, carrying a coffin and talking about how they had come to see Dr. Wang for their last breath.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Once at night, she was woken up by a voice that made her heart race. It was like something had gone wrong, with the sound of danger and terror. Wang Guo'er was pounding on the door as if she was calling out for help. She wore clothes that were overalls and had on a jacket, so she walked downstairs with her bag open, expecting to be called to help save the dying patient.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: One occasion she was awakened late at night. No one elsewhere was sleeping, and the sound was unexpected and alarming. Wang Qiyao's heart beatened with anxiety. She jumped out of bed, dived into the alley, and下了楼，在门上披了件厚棉袄。走近看，那个带着两把宽巾的人，是一两个乡镇上的孩子，抬着一个病人，那人也躺着死命挂床幔儿。据说是向王大富大夫求救。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: One night, she was woken by a call. The voice had sounded very alarming because it was made at midnight when everyone was fast asleep. Her heart pounded like a drum as she got dressed and went downstairs to let the two peasants in with their stretcher bearing the sick man who needed saving.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Once, while she was sleeping, she was awakened by a call she could not ignore, which carried with it a note of terror. Wang Qiyao's heart raced as she woke up; she threw off her sleepwear and slipped out of the room to go开门； two country folks, they said, had come for Dr. Wang to save their dying relative.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: One night she was woken by a call from someone outside. The noise was particularly unsettling, with a sense of urgency and terror. Wang Yijian's heart pounded as if it had been pounding for hours. She slipped on her clothes over her head and walked downstairs. She saw two farmers sitting on a bench, lying in bed with a dying patient. They said they needed help from Dr. Wang.

chinese: 轿夫们停住，呆呆地看着劈腿横在路当中的劫路人。 那人身材不高，脸上涂着黑墨，头戴一顶高粱篾片编成的斗笠，身披一件大蓑衣，蓑衣敞着，露出密扣黑衣和拦腰扎着的宽腰带。 腰里别着一件用红绸布包起的鼓鼓囊囊的东西。
english: The bearers stopped in their tracks and stared dumbstruck at the highwayman of medium height who stood in the road, his legs akimbo. He had smeared his face black and was wearing a conical rain hat woven of sorghum stalks and a broad-shouldered rain cape open in front to reveal a black buttoned jacket and a wide leather belt, in which a protruding object was tucked, bundled in red satin.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The men stopped on the street and stared at a man who was lying on the ground with his legs hanging over the road. His body was low and he wore a black mask, which was made of bamboo cloth that had been sewn together in a way that looked like a cap. The hat was high up on his head and it covered most of his face. He was wearing a large coat that was spread out over him, and the sleeves were open and there were strings tied around them. Inside the bag was something red that had been wrapped in a piece of paper.

The bearers stopped and stared, then, as he lay ahead across the road killing a highwayman: It was tall, with a thick headboard of dark-soiled straw; his body was covered by a long piece of sorghum cloth sewn at the waist; his belt was exposed, containing a tightly looped black garment that held him up. At the hem of his jacket were strings of red handkerchiefs.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The oxen stopped and gazed at the man who was squatting on the road, his legs crossed. He was a short man with black make-up smeared across his face. He wore a high reed hat made of straw and a long, wide belt around his waist. In his waistband was something wrapped in red silk.

The bearers halted, staring at the footpedaling highwayman; he was no more than five feet four inches tall, but his face was unusually handsome, covered with dark ink. He wore a willow top hat, a palm-bark rain cape, and a baggie of stuff around his waist, the front of which revealed a bright red band of cloth holding in place a bulging belly.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Men and women stopped at a crossroad as they watched a man who was on his knees with his legs crossed over the road. His body was not tall, but he had a thick black paint on his face, a cap of red fabric that covered his head, and a hat that hung from his shoulders. He was wearing a bag made of red cloth covering up his waist. Inside the bag were some bags that looked like they would be filled with things.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The bearers stopped and stared, then they looked like hardened criminals. The man, not very tall, had a thick, dark skin. He wore a piece of sorghum cloth for headgear, a piece of big rain-cape as护身草伞, and a belt loop around his waist. It hung loose from his hips. Inside was an object that appeared to be a red cloth兜子，loaded with black clothing扣子和腰带。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The cabbies stopped and stared at the man who was lying on his back, his legs spread out wide across the road. He was about a meter tall, with black makeup around his eyes and nose, wearing a high grass reed straw hat, and a large cloth cape. The cape was open and revealed the dark undergarment and the wide waistband of the broad belt that was tied tightly around his waist. Around his waist was a bundle of something red.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The bearers stopped and gazed at the footpaths blocker. The bandit was a fairly tall man, not much older than Wang Qiyao but taller than all of them. He was obviously used to leading a crowd.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The men stopped on the stairs. They stared at a man who had been thrown over the edge of the street as though he was being held up for auction. The man was tall with a small face covered by a black cap made from a woven cloth of cornmeal, which was hanging behind his head like a hat. His head was uncovered, showing off a pair of black gloves that were clasped around his wrists. In his waistcoat, there was a bag filled with something red.

chinese: 对，对，郡主娘娘，咱们刻好之后，我牵了你去长安门大街，大叫：‘哪一位客官要印乌龟？ 三文钱印一张！’
english: Ah, yes, Little Countess, I know what. When the carving's ready, I'll be able to take you out into Changan Street and set up there as a print-seller. 'Roll up, roll up!' I'll say. 'Buy a nice turtle print, three cash a sheet!'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Yes, yes, Lady Queen, we'll make sure everything is done for you before we take you to the Imperial City Street, calling out: "Whoever wants to print a turtle, please buy three pennies per piece!"

Yes, we'd cut out all the initials on the seal and call it 'The Merciful Princess '. Now I'll carry you off to the market at the heart of the city, and call the people who have been visitors a dragon! Carry them off three coppers for the cheapest Dragon-Lair print! —The Grinning Eunuch!'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Yes, yes, Fairy Princess, after we have made it, I will take you to Chang'an Street, where I will shout: ‘Who wants a print of the turtle? Three coins for one! ’

Yes, Lady Counterspine, that's the right word. Now we've got you tied up nice and straight, I'll go ringing round to theghetto and say 'Anyone wanting a diagram of a turtle to be etched on a piece of wood? Three cash. For each one!'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Yes, yes, Lady Queen of Heaven, we'll be making copies of this before you go to the Great Gate of the City. We'll call out: "Whoever is interested in printing an Antler, please pay three coins for each piece!"
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Yes, we'd cut out all the initials on the seal and go to the big door at the big top right of the city called 'The City of Chang-an'. Now, when a traveler wants to make a sale, we're going to shout: Who is this customer wanting to cut rovers out of his or her slip? Ten0 yuan for each one!
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Yes, yes, Miss Princess, after we carve it, I will take you to the Chang'an Gate Street, and loudly say: ‘Which guest is going to buy the tortoise? Three copper coins for one!’

chinese: 它原先是一片蛮荒地，荆榛苇茅丛生，狐狸野兔的乐园，后来有了几架牧人的草棚，后来逃来了杀人命犯、落魄酒徒、亡命赌棍…… 他们建造房屋，开垦荒地，拓扑出人的乐园，狐狸野兔迁徙他乡，临别时齐声发出控诉人类的鸣叫。
english: At one time the site had been a wasteland covered with brambles, underbrush, and reeds, a paradise for foxes and wild rabbits. Then a few huts appeared, and it became a haven for escaped murderers, drunks, gamblers, who built homes, cultivated the land, and turned it into a paradise for humans, forcing out the foxes and wild rabbits, who set up howls of protest on the eve of their departure.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The land was once a place of wilderness, where thorns and moss covered the ground, where foxes and rabbits roamed, and there were some wooden huts for the shepherd's wives to live in. But over time, they built a few houses, then came up with a few more, and then a few more, until they had all left their mark on people's lives. The foxes and rabbits migrated from one place to another, each calling out a cry of human distress.

Before then the place was nothing but ditches, willows, and foxes, herons, and weasels. Some monks had built cottages. Then traffic had come from farmers' huts, and lastly ruthless gamblers and thieves had run away, promising a place of death for anyone who crossed their path. The deer and foxes had fled to other parts, calling out curse words as they flew toward the destructed houses and turned back to see their human hosts.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: It was once a wild land of thorns, willows, and reeds, home to foxes and rabbits. But after that came several tents for farmers, then some fugitives from crime, outcasts from drinking, and gamblers who had run away from their lives… They built houses and cultivated the land, creating human gardens where foxes and rabbits migrated, and as they left, they all cried out against humanity.

A desolate wilderness once covered with bushes, sorghum, and reeds, it was home to foxes and rabbits until a few scattered huts were built by farmers and cultivated by settlers. Gloomy messages were emitted when the human inhabitants fled the land of their dreams.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The land was originally a desolate place, where wild thorns, ivy bushes, and rabbits roamed about. It was home to foxes, rabbits, and other animals. They constructed houses, cultivated farmland, and planted trees into their habitats, while the foxes and rabbits migrated from their homes. When they were left alone, they all shouted out of sorrow, "Mankind's cries!"

chinese: 村里街道上也水深及膝，骡马牛羊都泡在水里，水上漂着牲畜们稀薄的排泄物。
english: The water in the village was knee-high, covering the legs of livestock, whose waste floated on the surface.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Water was deep enough for a knee-high horse and mule and all the animals were soaking up the sewage from the water.
The streets were filled with water – at least six feet. Shefeng, mules, donkeys, and flocks of goats threw their stink as far away as possible.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The streets of the village were flooded up to their knees with water as well. Cattle, horses, and sheep were floating in it, while the feces from their urine was floating on top of the water.
On the streets of the village, the water was as deep as people's ankles, and mules, horses, and buffalo swam around in it until it was covered with their excrement.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Water is deep enough that horses, cattle, and sheep could be submerged in it. The water was floating around the dung of livestock.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The streets were filled with water – enough for a pair of shoes or a buffalo huss – and animals (horse, cattle, goats), human waste from their meals, bobbed and贝在水上漂着。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The streets of the village were also flooded up to the knee, horses, mules, and sheep all floating in the water, while their feces floated on top of it.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Village streets were waist-deep with water, even for the oxen and mules, who swam around floating chunks of their excrement.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: In the village streets as well, water was at least knee-deep; horses, mules, and cows were soaking wet; the water carried out of them the faintly defecating droppings of the livestock.

chinese: 我在一边看完了才走。
english: I didn't leave until I witnessed the whole episode.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: I have watched a movie on one side before I left.
I finished reading my story before I left and walked away from here.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: I finished watching before I left.
I finished reading it when I saw it.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: I finished reading a book on the other side of the street.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: As I finished reading, I left the office.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: I finished watching before I left.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I finished reading it when I saw it.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: I finished reading one book before I left.

chinese: 低头看去，宽阔笔直的马路上跑着如豆的汽车，成串的亮珠子。
english: Below, the cars speeding down the straight broad roads looked like a chain of pearls.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Looking down at them, there were like a dozen cars running on that straight road, each with a bright pearl shining from it.
As he looked down, a broad road was crossed by endless buses, connected by litters of watches.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Look down; the wide straight road is filled with small cars moving in rows of light beads.
But as he looked更低，他看见宽阔平坦的道路上飞舞着千百颗汽车灯，一列长的汽车像无数明亮的串联珍珠在行驶。
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Looking down at them, a long row of cars, all running like bullets across the straight road, with beads of light scattered everywhere.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: As he looked down, a broad, plathographic road was being overtaken by vast, unbroken lines of red-and-white buses.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Looking down, a broad straight road is filled with cars like tiny beads running in rows.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Lowering his head, he could see wide, straight roads filled with cars travelling at a steady pace like faraway sparks on a broad road.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: As one walks by a wide road of cars running like beans, there are numerous small beads of light.

chinese: 成名如此之早，当真古今罕有。”
english: To have won such fame, and so early in life too, is an almost unparalleled achievement.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: It was so early for him that he had never seen anything like it before."
And he did, apparently, during his lifetime, '
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Such a great success at such a young age is truly unprecedented in history."
To be named after so young an age is indeed rare indeed.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: It is so early that it is rare for anything to be born this way."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: And he did, you know, when you first became famous . . .'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: He was so famous at such a young age, truly rare indeed.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: To be a success like this early in life—isn't that rare history?'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The translation of this phrase from Chinese to English is: "It's a great honor for him to be born so early."

chinese: 待雄飞高举，明冬再晤，岂非大快之事！”
english: How delightful it will be to meet again next winter when you have distinguished yourself by soaring to the top over all the other candidates!'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Wait for his flight to take him up high, then we will meet again next winter. Is this not a great thing!"
The sight of him soaring high above the frost-free air and meeting up with her again in the clear winter days to pursue their shared desire... that sounds like a very satisfying affair.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Wait for the king to fly high and meet again in the winter!"
When you are ready to carry your flight, I shall expect to see you again soon in the winter.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Let him fly high and meet again in winter, what is not a big pleasure!"
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Had we got lucky and won that contest, what would have been the plaisir of catching a freebird in winter!'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Let him soar high in the winter, we will meet again in the coming year!"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: When you are finally freed, come back here again冬天里。 Then we can meet once more, and I promise you a快乐的事!'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Wait for him to fly high and meet again next winter, isn't that a great pleasure!"

chinese: 纵声大笑，身子跟着乱动，右腿一曲，右手已抓住了匕首柄，极慢极慢的从剑鞘中拔出，不发出丝毫声息，就算有了些微声，也教笑声给遮掩住了。
english: He kept up the artificial laughter in order to cover up the wriggling of his body. While he was talking and laughing he had managed to draw up his right leg so that he could get his hand on the dagger in his boot and draw it from its sheath. Any slight sound that this operation might have given rise to was masked by his idiotic cachinnation.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Quietly laughing, his body moved as if he was following a song. He raised his right leg and grasped the handle of the knife, slowly and carefully from the sheath of the sword. There was no sound when he pulled out the blade, not even a single sound. Even if there was a slight noise, it would be drowned out by the laughter.

He let out a great loud cry, and gave way to wild movements which made his right leg turn aside; then he drew his dagger from his sheath and picked it suddenly out of it. He allowed none of the noises that should be made, although they seemed almost imperceptible, to掩盖他的欢声笑闹。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Laughing loudly, he moved about wildly with his body, bending his right leg and grasping the handle of the dagger with his left hand. chinese: 像她们这样半路上的朋友，各有各的隐衷，别看严家师母竹筒倒豆子，内中也有自己未必知道的保留，彼此并不知根知底，能有一些同情便可以了。
english: People like them, who become friends at mid-life, tend to keep part of themselves hidden away. Even Madame Yan, who usually wore her heart on her sleeve, retained certain secrets that she herself might not have understood. It was not necessary for them to know everything there was to know about each other—a little sympathy went a long way.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: As friends on the way, each with his own hidden motives, it seems that there are different ones for each of them, not that I don’t know anything about the secret or their background, but you can have some sympathy if you want.

People like Wang Qiyao and her friends who came and visited could hardly be described as easy to know. Madam and Mrs. Liu had hidden secrets that they hardly ever mentioned, and no one knew what behind them; yet they did not know each other's hearts and souls and could not build up a solid foundation before offering a怜惜的眼光。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: As half-way friends, they each have their own secrets, like Lady Yin who poured out her chest as if pouring out a jar of beans – there might be some things she did not know herself, but we do not need to know everything about them; just that little bit of sympathy would suffice.

A friend who does not know you all the way has different constraints than she does with regular friends. Even if Madame Yan is willing to go on delivering seeds, there are things she may not want to reveal. It's a matter of trust. They are glad for her simple kindness, but try to act as if they are on equal terms.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Like this kind of friends who meet halfway, each with his own hidden interests, I don’t see how well you know Mrs. Li’s secret; we don’t know where she is from, so what can we say?
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Wang Qiyao's friends were all different enough to keep her going; even those who drove by didn't know what she was going through and had no way of knowing the depth of her hidden feelings. A little kindness would go a long way to keeping her going.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Those who are friends halfway on their way, each with their own secrets, like Madame Cang of Guan. She does not know what is hidden inside her own chest, but she can understand that others do not know it either. If they can show some understanding, then they will be happy enough.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: If they were to claim each other as friends, they would have to make some sacrifices. It was true that Madame Yan spilt beans like a dripping bamboo barrel, but there must be things she did not know about her friend that she did not share; none of them placed themselves entirely in their friend's shoes, and all they wanted in return for their devotion was a bit of understanding and sympathy.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Like friends who meet halfway on the way, each with their own hidden inclinations, I don’t mean to say that Uncle Li is a fool for putting up such a joke; there may be something we didn’t know that he doesn’t know either. And I can understand them if they can share some compassion with us.

chinese: 韦小宝想问他什么叫神堂穴、环跳穴，如何点穴、解穴，但转念一想，自己是青木堂香主，又是总舵主的弟子，连点穴、解穴也不会，岂不是让下属们太也瞧不起？ 反正对付一个小姑娘总不是什么难事，点头道：“知道了。”
english: Trinket wanted to ask him where the Holy Hall and Ring Jump vital points were and how you closed and opened them; but then he remembered that, as Master of the Green Wood Lodge and a disciple of the great Helmsman, he was probably expected to know about these things and felt sure his subordinates would despise him if they found out that he was totally ignorant of these matters; so he just nodded and said that he would. 'Anyway, ' he thought, 'I shouldn't have any difficulty in handling her. She's only a girl.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Qian Xiaobang wanted him to know what a Heaven Pavilion穴和环跳穴是什么意思，怎样用功法来点穴和解穴，但转过头来看，自己是青木堂香主，又是总舵主的弟子，连点穴、解穴都不会，难道会让下属们看轻他？反正对付一个小姑娘的事情也不是很难，点头应道：“知道了。”

I don't know about that secret word you're talking about, Brother,' Trinket was about to asking them what it meant, 'but I do know that it's where a man puts his thumb against whose aim to cause pain and then removes it again as soon as he wants it to stop. It's also the same thing you did when we put our fingers on your target—to give or remove pain as quickly as we want.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Wu Xiaoliao wanted to ask him what was a "temple" point and an "arrowhead point", how to do acupuncture and acupressure, but he thought better of it. He was the head disciple of the main hall and the chief of the grotto, so he couldn't even do acupuncture and acupressure. Isn't that embarrassing? Anyway, dealing with a young girl isn't difficult at all. Wu Xiaoliao nodded his head and said, "I understand."

He was thinking of asking the questions that involved names of acupoints and how to stimulate them and how to find the same acupoints after one had been stimulated, but he decided it would be enough for him to be a Taoist副主子和舵主的弟子, even though he didn't know what acupoints were, to be looked down on by his subordinates, when he could do nothing of the sort. He settled for a simple 'yes' instead.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Wu Xiaobang wants to know what the "Shaoyan Pavilion" and "Cuihuan Pavilion" mean, how to tap them, and what to do with them, but he thought back to himself that he was the head of the Young Bamboo Temple, which was the principal's disciple, and even if he could not perform these things, it would not be fair for his subordinates to look down upon him? After all, dealing with a little girl was not something that was difficult at all. He nodded his head: "I will understand."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I've no idea what those terms are; I don't know how to use it except to pick a number. I haven't ever done anything like this before myself. So it must be really hard for someone like Brother Wei to find out what a神堂穴是什么意思, or how to do it, or—what matters most—and even getting him to解开我的穴具也不容易。 It's hardly a problem I can solve myself.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Wu Xiaogang wanted to ask him what he meant by "sacred hall points" and "ring point". How did he use them? But then he thought of his position as the head monk of the Yellow Wood Hall and his master's disciple, and even if he couldn't use them himself, he didn't want his subordinates to think that he was too incompetent. In the end, it would be fine for a little girl. He nodded and said, "I understand."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Trinket was about to ask what the Godit was for and where they got their name 'Ringit' from and whether they were supposed to be able to needle and unneedle them—and all the other things that go with it—but he realised that asking these questions would involve giving the girl one of his greater superiors whom he did not know very well a handout, so he changed his mind and took the girl at her word. 'All right, I've heard,' he said.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Zhu Xiaobang wanted to know what a heaven temple point is, how to point it out, and what to do with it, but when he thought about it, he was a member of the Qingming Temple's headmaster, and his chief secretary was also a student who had been under his tutelage. He could not even point or solve for it, would that really make them all look down on him?" No problem! I will now tell you.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The talk was not quite coherent, but it was a kind of truth-telling under the influence of alcohol. Otherwise, he would not have said such things.

chinese: 顾炎武道：“当今之世，便真有桃源乐土，咱们也不能独善其身，去躲了起来……”
english: 'Come,' said Gu, 'even if there were such a place, we cannot, as individuals, opt out altogether. In times like these—'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Wu Zhenwu said: "In this age of today, we must have a paradise that is real, and it is not right for us to stay alone…"
Well, nowadays,' Gu Yanwu continued, 'there is actually no such paradise on this earth where people can live completely off themselves and avoid dealing with it.!'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Gu Fengwu said, "In this era of our time, even if we really have a paradise, we can't escape from it and go hide."
In these days of upheaval,' said Gu Yanwu, 'a true Utopia is still a rare thing. How realistic can our individual duties be expected to be?'

chinese: 轿夫们的话更加粗野了，他们有的骂我外曾祖父是个见钱眼开的小人，有的说鲜花插到牛粪上，有的说单扁郎是个流白脓淌黄水的麻风病人。
english: The bearers' banter turned coarse. One of them reviled my great-granddad for being a money-grabber, another said something about a pretty flower stuck into a pile of cowshit, a third called Shan Bianlang a scruffy leper who oozed pus and excreted yellow fluids.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The men of the carriage were rougher than before; they had spat out the words that I was called a scoundrel who had no heart for money. They had said that flowers should have been planted on top of rotten meat, and that single chin-rails was a person with a bad mouth and a nose full of pus from a syphilis patient.
They became even crude, insulting my great- grandfather as much as being a目光短浅的顽固保守的企业家, disliking Mother Lemon as a clean-blooded sick man, and deriding Single Ahn-Lan as a leeches疮深红紫的麻风病人.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The shouts of the ox-dragons grew more rude as they continued to insult my grandfather, who was a small-minded man for money. Some said that he had turned his nose up at flowers because he found them dirty. Others said that he had made a fool out of himself by sticking his nose into other people's business. One even accused him of having the skin of a leper.

The bearers became more coarse. One said that Grandfather had sold his inheritance to a money-hungry little bastard, another that it was like placing a bunch of roses in the manure, yet another that Shan Bianlang was a leper who scurried outdoors to dump his exudate on people.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The servants' words became more coarse, as they said that I was a little man who was not sensitive to money, some accused me of being a little person who did not care about money, while others accused me of having flowers on his stool and a sick patient of being a white脓疮、noodles, and yellow water.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: They became even rudenessful; one or two called me a short-sighted old man, others accused me of only paying attention to money; one said Brother Singlehad a bad skin from yellowing cloth dung, and another说我是一个麻风病人。

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The bearers became more coarse. One said that my great-grandfather had sold his soul to the devil for money. chinese: 这一晚是国庆夜，有哪幢楼的平台上，放起礼花，孤零零的一朵，在湛黑的天空上缓缓地舒开叶瓣，又缓缓凋零成细细的流星，渐渐消失，空中还留有一团浅白的影。
english: The party took place on the evening of National Day and fireworks were being set off from one of the balconies. A solitary flower lay in the blackness of the night, slowly opening its petals and slowly turning into a thin stream of light, fading away, leaving behind a white trail in the air.

It was a late night on October 1st, and people were lit up everywhere, splicing fireworks into the air from platforms, domes, and rooftops. A lone star dropped, like a gentle kiss from heaven, as it slowly faded into nothingness, stars shining against its streaking edges, but also left behind a white specktip.

A lone flower stood on a black sky, opening its petals slowly, then closing them slowly, fading into tiny stars, gradually disappearing, leaving behind a faint white shadow in the air.

chinese: 唉，睡觉的时候以后可多着呢，朝也睡，晚也睡，睡着了永远不醒。

chinese: 爷爷走着，他已经感觉不到自己的腿在何处，只是凭着一种走的强烈意念，在僵硬的空气的浊浪中，困难地挣扎。
english: All that kept Granddad moving was a powerful drive to push on and continue the bitter struggle against wave after murky wave of obdurate air.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The grandfather walks, feeling no longer that his legs were at home but rather that he was walking with a strong will in a foggy sea of air.
Granddad went walking杖不离手，那感觉已极微妙,在他思想的硬壳中,顽强的空气努力向前冲。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Grandfather walked; he no longer knew where his legs were, but he was struggling against a strong urge to walk through thick, foggy air.
He no longer knew where his legs were; all he had was a strong will to keep walking, through impenetrable air currents swirling relentlessly around him.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Grandpa walked on, not noticing his legs where they were, just feeling the strong urge to walk through the dense fog of air.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Granddad walked off with his spirit, and Shi-yin couldn't feel where his leg was anymore; he did this by channeling a strong feeling he seemed to have. He was struggling hard in the clod of the stagnant ocean of air.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Grandfather walked, he did not even know where his legs were anymore. He struggled against the thick fog of hardening air with a strong will to walk.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: He no longer knew precisely where his legs ended and his body began; all he had left was a strong will to keep walking through an air teeming with stagnant waves.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Grandpa walks slowly, feeling no longer that his legs were in the place they were supposed to be. He was just walking with a strong, steady wave of air around him.

chinese: 如今出挑的美人儿似的，少说着只怕有一万心眼子；再要赌口齿，十个会说的男人也说不过他呢！
english: She's grown up to be a real beauty too, has Mrs Lian. But sharp! Well, if it ever comes to a slanging match, she can talk down ten grown men any day of the week!
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Now she is a kind of woman who makes you want to say something but can't say it because there's only one mouth that speaks to her; then, if she wants to bet words, ten men would not be able to explain him!

Those on the cusp of adulthood must know by now that being a beautiful one is no sign of intelligence; besides, even those men who aren't very clever will try to argue with them about it anyway, because they know how important it is.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Now that she is out on her own, she may have a thousand wits; even if you talk with her for ten minutes, no man can talk with her more than one hundred times!

A young beauty like this is a very dangerous asset. If we gambit her, ten men would be hard put to it to keep up with her; and if we don't gamble, we've still got to be able to speak fluently, and nobody can speak better than a lady like her.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Like a woman with sharp teeth, she might be said to have one thousand eyes; even if she wants to make a wager with ten men who can't speak, they'll all be unable to understand her!"
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: People who shine more than others is better; a man who tells the truth is more popular than one who doesn't.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Now a young beauty like this, if one were to talk of her thoughts, there would be as many as ten thousand; even ten men who could speak would not be able to say anything about her!
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: She sounds like a young beauty going out to dance whom her gentleman friend promises to accompany; for all that, not only has he mastered the hardest languages in the land, but to take part in a debate on them would be to give him far more than he would have ever expected!'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Now, a woman who is out of her depth! She might have one thousand eyes if she spoke more; ten men would not be able to tell him from his words!

chinese: 我办过一个盗窃案，罪犯能把行驶中的列车中间的一节车厢偷了，前后的其余部分又完好地接起来开到终点站，用的工具只是一根钢丝绳和几只铁钩子。
english: I once handled a robbery where the criminals managed to steal one car out of a moving train. They reconnected the cars before and after the one they were interested in so that the train got all the way to its destination without anyone noticing. The only tools they used were a length of wire cable and a few steel hooks.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: I committed a theft once, and the criminal could steal from the middle of the train, and the other parts were perfectly intact after that, using tools just one piece of steel rope and several iron hooks.

I committed a robbery several times. The robber would steal a section of the trainbeds from the back, put on the front, and keep the entire shipbuilding building from turning up at the end, with tools just a raw stock of steel chains and some iron hooks.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: I had done a robbery where the thief was able to steal one compartment of a train while the rest were intact and reconnected at the end station using just a piece of wire and some iron hooks.
I solved a theft case where the perpetrator had moved a section of the train between stations with no one noticing.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: I have committed a theft before, and one of my accomplices was able to steal the middle section of each train's carriages, with the remaining sections intact and open at the end station. The tools used were just two steel ropes and a few iron hooks.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I committed a theft once. The perpetrator would steal a section of the trainbeds from the back end and replace it with a intact center carriage, with a few bricolage tools, including a raw piece of steel rope and a few iron hooks.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: I have handled a theft case. The thief could steal one section of a train that was moving on the tracks, while the rest of it was intact and connected together to be driven to its destination using just a piece of wire and some iron hooks.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I solved a theft case back when. The criminal had moved an entire section of the train between two stations using a steel cable and some iron hooks, and only used these tools. . . .
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: I have committed a theft case, and the culprit could steal the entire first floor of a train car after it had started moving, then connect the remaining parts back up at the end station using only a single piece of steel cable and several metal hooks.

chinese: 老耿那时已七十多岁，孤身一人，享受“五保”待遇，是村里德高望重的人物，每逢诉苦大会，都要他上台诉苦。 每次诉苦，他都要剥掉上衣，露出一片疤痕。
english: Old Geng, who was already over seventy by then and lived alone as a pensioner, was one of our most revered villagers. Asked to speak at meetings to air grievances against the old order, he invariably stripped to the waist onstage to show his scars.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: In old age, when he was seventy years old, he was alone on his own. He was a respected figure of the village, and whenever someone complained about something, he would be called up to speak. Every time they complained, he would peel off his clothes revealing a scar.
Old Geng was a seventy-year-old man, alone and single, who enjoyed the welfare grant of "five resides," given to poor elders and retired men on镇政府的德高望重的人物。 Whenever they met for恳职大会，他就要扒了衣服，露出了疤。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Lao Ge was seventy years old then, alone, enjoying "Five Guarantees" benefits, a person of great respect in the village, he would always be asked to speak at the meeting. At each meeting, he would take off his shirt, exposing a scar.

Old Geng had been alone all his life, enjoying five-star benefits as a village veteran. Every month he attended a meeting where he was required to complain. Every time, he took off his shirt, revealing the rows of scars covering his back.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: At that time, he was seventy years old. He was alone, enjoying "Five-Per-Head" benefits, which were bestowed upon him by the villagers with high reputation. Whenever he would tell his story at the complaint session, he would have to take off his clothes and show a scar on his chest.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Old Geng was a seventy-year-old man, single-registered absent-mindedly on benefit land, a very high-sounding name in the village, and whenever every monthly hardship speech大会上他上台演讲,剥光衬衫露出个疤。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Old General was seventy years old then, alone, enjoying "Five Guards" benefits, he was a person of high moral character in the village. He had to speak at every meeting where people complained, each time he would remove his shirt and show a scar.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Old Geng had fallen on hard times and was enjoying full benefits as a 'five-star' beneficiary of the village. Every month he went to see the county governor, who would hear him complain about his lot. Always bare-chested, he exposed the scars that dotted his upper arm.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: At that time, he was eighty-seven years old, alone on his own, enjoying “five-star待遇”， a figure of great honor among the villagers, who often attended the complaint meeting. Whenever he had trouble to tell his story, he would have him strip off his clothes and expose the scars on his chest.

chinese: 这天下午，程先生提前下班，买了菜到王琦瑶处，两人将孩子哄睡了，便一起忙了起来，一边忙一边说话。
english: On the afternoon of the dinner Mr. Cheng left work early to pick up the food for that evening. They put the baby to bed early and chatted as they cooked.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: This evening, Mr. Chen bought vegetables at Ouyang Guoran's house and then took them home together. He was busy talking as he prepared food for the children.

On the way home, Mr. Cheng took some soup to warm Wang Qiyao's child while she slept; they both lay down together, talked as much during their dinner time as they could manage, and then changed into clothes and headed out of the apartment building.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: That afternoon, Mr Cheng left work early, bought some groceries at Wang Qiuyue’s place, and went back with them to take care of their son until they fell asleep together. They talked as they worked.
Mr. Cheng left work early that afternoon and bought some groceries on his way to Wang Qiyao's. They divided up the chores while they waited for the baby to fall asleep—cooking, cleaning, and talking.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: This evening, Mr. Cheng left home early and bought some food at Ouyang Guoran's place. They took their children to sleep together, while talking as they did so.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: On the way home, Cheng Yuhuang took early off from work and, getting a bit ahead of schedule, bought some groceries for his family and took the two-year-old out on the walk. unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: That afternoon, Mr Cheng left work early and went to Wang Qi'er’s house with some food. They took care of the children and then got busy together while talking.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Mr. Cheng arrived home early that afternoon and, with a bottle of wine in one hand and a loaf of bread in the other, went to Wang Qiyao's place. They took care of the child while they chatted.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: This afternoon, Mr. Chen left home early and bought some food at Mrs. Wang's house. He took his daughter to bed, so he started working on it. While working, they talked together.

chinese: 这情景持续了很长时间后，她在朦胧中想到，这可能就是她永恒的归宿了，这就是她的地狱，三个太阳构成的地狱之火将永远灼烧着她，这是她因那个超级背叛受到的惩罚。
english: This state lasted for some time, and she hazily thought it was probably the end for her. It was her hell. The fire of the three suns would torment her and burn her forever. This was punishment for her betrayal, the betrayal that exceeded all others.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The scene continued for a long time after which she realized that this was her eternal destination; it was the hell, the three suns forming the hell of hell itself burning its fire on her forever, this being the punishment for her having committed the super treason.
After a long time, she could smell the scent of death drifting through the village. Three suns were capable of burning hot within her heart, and that was the punishment for her betrayal.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: After a long time, she drifted back into consciousness, thinking that this might be her eternal home. This was her hell, the fire of three suns burning on forever, as punishment for the great betrayal she had suffered.

The scene changed slowly over a period of some time. Suddenly she became blurry-eyed and realized that this might be her eternal home. That was the hell she deserved; three suns formed the flames of hell that would burn forever on her skin.

chinese: 平安里的一日生计，是在喧嚣之中拉开帷幕；粪车的轱辘声，涮马桶声，几十个煤球炉子在弄堂里升烟，隔夜洗的衣衫也晾出来了，竹竿交错，好像在烟幕中升旗。
english: Mornings, however, begin with night-soil carts, clattering in to collect waste for fertilizer, and the raspy noises of brushes scrubbing out commodes. Amid the smoke of coal burners, laundry soaked overnight is taken out to be hung, banner-like, on bamboo poles.

The daily tasks of Peace Lane all converge on a stage of tumultuous activity. The rattle of the grumblings of the looters or the rotating spindles of the sores who screech through the longtang becomes mixed with the laundry noises of countless coal-heap stoves to create a skyline that rises and falls like the sun screening the flag as it rises in the fog.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: A day's wage at Peaceful Street is being launched amidst a cacophony; the sound of a horse-drawn cart wheeling through the alleyway, the sound of a toilet brush scraping against porcelain, the clattering of dozens of coal-oil stoves, and the overnight washing clothes hanging out on the lines; the bamboo poles interlocking, it seems as if they were raising the flag in the smoke-filled air.

The hustle-bustle-ah-ah of Peace Lane ushered in yet another day. Vendors' tugs on their carts awakened the neighborhood; through the longtang doors, the cooking smoke from a dozen or so stoves drifted outside, forming a sort of flag in the air.

chinese: 其实伟大友谊不真也不假，就如世上一切东西一样，你信它是真，它就真下去。 你疑它是假，它就是假的。 我的话也半真不假。 但是我随时准备兑现我的话，哪怕天崩地裂也不退却。
english: Actually, the great friendship was neither true nor false, like everything else in the world. The great friendship was not fake or false; just like everything in the world. You believed it to be real; it became real. I could be real, too, either partially true or partially false. But I was also ready to fulfill my word: whatever happens, will happen, no matter how huge the earth falls or how destructive the lightning.

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: In reality, a friendship that is true and not false is like everything around us, just as all things in the world exist and change without ever changing their state. But I am always prepared to fulfill my words, even if the Earth collapses or the sun breaks.

chinese: 那种有前客堂和左右厢房里的流言是要老派一些的，带薰衣草的气味的；而带亭子间和拐角楼梯的弄堂房子的流言则是新派的，气味是樟脑丸的气味。
