chinese: 只是父亲、伯叔、兄弟之伦，因是圣人遗训，不敢违忤，所以弟兄间亦不过尽其大概就罢了，并不想自己是男子，须要为子弟之表率。
english: Only in the case of his father, uncles and brother, where rudeness and disobedience were expressly forbidden by the teachings of Confucius, did he make an exception – and even then the allowances he made in respect of the fraternal bond were extremely perfunctory. It certainly never occurred to him that his own maleness placed him under any obligation to set an example to the younger males in his clan.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Just as the brothers, parents, etc., do not dare to contradict or violate the instruction of the saint; so they just don’t want to make any difference at all. And I do not think myself a man; I need to be a model for the children.
As is the custom, for historical reasons,' he says, 'with no intention that he himself than to lead by example.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Only father, uncle, brother's ranks are because they are teachings of Confucius, so they dare not disobey, therefore between brothers, it is just enough to be a general example for them, and doesn't want to themselves as men, must be a model for their children.

But it was a case of older persons intervening between you and your father and your伯叔， and so you had but to give an outline of what you did. You didn't think much of yourselves as brothers, and wanted merely to perform your duty as sons.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Only father, brother, and uncle have been given this name; they are not supposed to violate it, so there is no need for them to be very detailed about their relationship with each other. However, I do not want myself to be a man, but I must act as a model for my children.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: But as there is no such law in Father's book as 'discipline for sonship' (which requires a man to be mature and not to be presumptuous) and his father has promised never to breach it, he follows the custom of saying nothing at all. He knows that if he was to be a good grandfather he would have to do his best to lead his grandchildren by example.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Only fathers, uncles, brothers, etc., who are descendants of the Holy Man, do not dare to violate the instructions, so between brothers, it is just enough for them to do what they can. They don't want to be a model for their younger brothers either.

chinese: 总舵主道：“你要入会，倒也可以。 只是我们干的是反清复明的大事，以汉人的江山为重，自己的身家性命为轻。
english: 'If you want to be a member you can,' said the Helmsman, 'only you must remember that this is a very important business we are engaged in. We have to put our country first, even before our lives.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: If you want to join our society, I suppose I could make an exception,' said the Helmsman. chinese: 国家兴亡，匹夫有责，暂时避祸则可，但若去躲在桃花源里，逍遥自在，忍令亿万百姓在鞑子铁蹄下受苦，于心何安？
english: The citizen of a conquered country still has his duty. It's all very well to take temporary refuge, but to live a life of ease in some Peach Tree Haven while millions are suffering under the iron heel of the Tartars would be less than human.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The country's prosperity is at stake; we can be there temporarily if we hide behind a garden of flowers or live free from the shackles of government control. But if we stay in a place where people suffer under the iron fist of their enemies, how could our hearts be at peace?

Where do you want to hide when the country is in trouble?'-well, you can't stay at a far-off place like roses; your conscience won't allow you. But let us pretend to live in舒服的桃花源，and when the噩梦来临，当真的落到那芸念炎黄的铁枪和铜炮中，那可是死也不甘于命!
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Responsibility for the fate of a country lies with all citizens. It is possible to temporarily avoid trouble but one must not hide away in some idyllic place, living life on the easy road. One must endure watching the suffering of millions of people at the mercy of the Tartar yoke.

Those who see themselves as responsible for their country should not shy away from facing up to the problems now confronting it. Temporal power is all that matters in the end, and hiding away in a green gourd's paradise is not going to cut it. If so doing were enough to protect them from ultimate disaster, we might question whether they were doing their duty; but it is estimated that tens of thousands of innocent souls in Russia are currently suffering under the yoke of the Tartars, and yet not a soul among them has dared to hide away rather than face up to the truth.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: In China's name is the nation's fate; if we could hide away for a while, then perhaps it would be alright, but if we stayed behind in the heart of the Forbidden City, where the sun never set and the moon never waxed out, we'd suffer under the iron fist of the Mongol Empire. What is this?
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Where do you want to hide?' I asked when we first arrived at Tangente. The place to live out our time here temporarily would have been a fair place to call home if we had chosen it. But we could only stay so long—hell, why should we?
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Responsibility for a nation's rise or fall is on every citizen, but if one chooses to hide away in a "utopia" like a garden, how can they feel at peace with themselves knowing that their fellow citizens are suffering under the yoke of the Mongol horsemen?
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Those who see themselves as responsible for their country should not shy away from doing what is necessary to avert it. In the short term such action would be justified; but to retreat into a utopia made of blooming apricots is not only enabling millions of subjects to kneel unceasingly under the Tartar iron foot, but utterly unacceptable.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The state of one's nation is in the hands of those who govern it; when you go there temporarily, you can do something about it. But if you stay behind in the land of the peasants and let them suffer under the iron heel of the conquerors, how can you feel at ease?

chinese: 高粱棵子里似乎有痛苦的呻吟声，尸体堆中好像有活物的蠕动，父亲想唤住爷爷，去看看这些尚未死利索的乡亲。 他仰起脸来，看到爷爷那副绿锈斑斑、丧失了人的表情的青铜面孔，把话儿压进了喉咙。
english: Tortured moans emerged from the field of sorghum, and here and there among the bodies some movement appeared. Father was burning to ask Granddad to save those fellow villagers who were still alive, but when he saw the pale, expressionless look on his father's bronze face, the words stuck in his throat.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: In the milker's field, there was a faint sound of pain in the dead bodies; in the graveyards, there were living beings moving around, and the father wanted to call up his grandfather, to see those who had not yet recovered from their injuries. He raised his eyes to look at the iron-faced bronze face of his grandfather, and pressed the words into his mouth.

The sorghum fields seemed to啼哭, moving corpses within their nests looked as if alive; Father thought for a moment that he should go and see the dead, but Granddad's greenly scarred, decimated face blocked its desire.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The corn stalks seemed to be moaning with pain, while the corpses seemed to be moving, Father wanted to call out to his grandfather and go and see these people who had not yet died. He raised his face and saw Grandfather's face, which was covered with green rust stains and lacked human expression, and he choked back the words.

Father heard muffled cries coming from hidden places in the sorghum fields, and felt the earth move under his feet as he saw batches of corpses wriggling out of their graves, calling for him. He gazed up until the bruised metal face of Granddad penetrated the thick haze of emotion that choked him.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: There is a wailing sound in the high粱树下， and there's movement in the corpses of some of them as if it were living creatures. The farmer wanted to call his grandfather to see these people who had not yet recovered from their deaths. He lifted his face and saw the wrinkled, disfigured copper faces of his grandpa, which he was trying to put into his mouth.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The sorghum fields seemed to scream out with pain; corpses in the field moved slowly through the roots as though moving alive, causing Father to want to reach out and see the recently dead, apparently僵化到极限的同胞们。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: There seemed to be a moaning sound from inside the sorghum stalks, and there was a movement of living things among the corpses. He wanted to call out to his grandfather, to go and see these still living people who were not yet dead. He raised his face, seeing the green rust stains on his grandfather's faceless, expressionless bronze face as he tried to speak, but it was swallowed by his throat.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Sobs echoed in the sorghum fields, corpses twitched in the mounds; Father wanted to call out to Granddad, to see what was wrong with these poor souls who had not yet died of old. He raised his face, until his eyes were buried deep in the redness of his rusted-out face, and called out, but his voice got caught in his throat.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: In the milker's yard there was a faint sound of sorrow; the corpses in the graveyard seemed to have some living creatures moving about, while his father wanted to call up his aged grandfather to see those still unharmed from death. He raised his eyes and saw that the rough-faced face of his uncle, whose face had been tarnished with age, was being pressed into his throat.

chinese: 他迷迷糊糊的睡了一会，悄悄起身，把那盒蜜饯糕饼揣在怀里，生怕惊醒海老公，慢慢一步步的蹑足而出，走到门边，轻轻拔开了门闩，再轻轻打开了一扇门，突然听得海老公问道：“小桂子，你去哪里？”
english: After sleeping fitfully for what must have been several hours, he got up silently, stuffed the box of cakes inside his breast pocket,and made his way on tiptoe across the room, pausing at each step for fear the old eunuch might waken. Then, slowly and gently, he slid back the door-bar and opened one of the leaves of the door. At that very moment he heard the old eunuch's voice calling out from behind him. 'Laurie, where are you going?'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: He was drowsy for a moment before he slowly rose from his bed, and took the honey rolls and cookies in his pocket, fearing that they would wake up his husband, so quietly he walked along with him slowly until he reached the door and then gently opened the lock of the door, hearing his wife say in a low voice, "Where did you go, little桂子？"
But for a moment or two he was asleep until the old eunuch came冲击着他，悄声如鼠地从他身后悄悄走过，轻轻打开门，一睁眼，只见海老公站在门口，微笑道: "小桂子，你去了哪里？」
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: He fell asleep for a while and got up quietly. He put the box of sweet confection in his pocket, afraid to wake up his husband. He slowly walked out one step at a time and reached the door. He opened it gently and suddenly heard his husband ask, "Little Gaozi, where are you going?"

He slept vaguely for a while, too sleepy to dream, as he slipped out of bed, slid the box inside his jacket, and very carefully made his way to the door. With great care he inserted the catch and opened the door just a crack; then, very quietly, he slipped outside and drew the door open again, just above the old man's next question.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: He was half asleep, then he quietly got up and put the honey cake and almond cookies in his pocket, hoping not to wake up his husband, slowly and carefully walked out one by one, coming towards the door, gently opened a door and then suddenly heard his husband ask him, "Where is Little Luise?"
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Not knowing where he had fallen asleep, he got up from bed, surreptitiously stuffing the cake in his pocket, though he soon found he could not see the old eunuch when he stepped out of bed. He slowly strode towards the gate with the door open; then he heard the old eunuch asking, 'Little Liu, where have you been?'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: He dozed off for a while, quietly getting up, taking the box of sweet cakes out of his pocket, afraid to wake up the sea husband, slowly making his way to the door, pulling the lock open with care, then opening another door slightly, suddenly hearing the sea husband say: "Little Guozi, where are you going?"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: He dozed off for a while on the floor without answering, then quietly slipped the box of Tartlets to himself. Stepping lightly out of his bedromb and through the door, he turned to the side and flung open a door which led onto the ground. Suddenly he heard Old Hai ask, 'Laurel, where are you going?'

chinese: 夜色灰葡萄，金风串河道，宝蓝色的天空深邃无边，绿色的星辰格外明亮。 北斗勺子星——北斗主死，南斗簸箕星——南斗司生、八角玻璃井——缺了一块砖，焦灼的牛郎要上吊，忧愁的织女要跳河…… 都在头上悬着。
english: On that grey-purple night a golden breeze followed the course of the river. The sapphire-blue sky was deep and boundless, green-tinted stars shone brightly in the sky: the ladle of Ursa Major (signifying death), the basket of Sagittarius (representing life); Octans, the glass well, missing one of its tiles; the anxious Herd Boy (Altair), about to hang himself; the mournful Weaving Girl (Vega), about to drown herself in the river. . . .
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The night is gray with grapes, the wind blows through the river, blue skies stretch on out side of the eyes, green stars shine bright. The北斗七星——北斗主死了, the South Star —— South star was born; the eight-corner glass basin —— the one that has a stone missing from it, burning with anger for his wife, the lonely lady must be jumping off the river… They all hang above their heads.

The night turns as mauve into green, the black sky extends unboundless; the star of the River Of Gold – the constellation of current death – the Bell Pointrun of the South – the Crab of the Moon – a brick is missing – the woman of the North – she would have to jump into the river if she hung up her wedding ring – both women are mourning, unhappy, and their heads hang silently by their sides....
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Dark grapes of night, golden wind through rivers, a blue sky deep and vast, the green stars shine brightly. The spoon of the north star – death of the northern star, the箕-shaped star of south pole – life of the southern star, the glass well with eight corners – missing a brick, anxious shepherds want to hang themselves, worried weavers want to jump into the river… All hanging above their heads.

Underneath the dark green heavens, a Pocky Bridge, gilded windrows of wheat, and a deep-blue sky where even the stars seem unusually bright afford hints of what may lie in store for those who seek it—the Delimiter Pole shows that the Delimiters have fallen but the Stork Galaxy awaits birth, so the Delimiters' broken watermill indicates that there is a leak in the supporting beam that carries the mill's nameplate; moreover, the absent Guardian Star suggests that the wife of the delimiters has sunk into sorrowful melancholia about the loss of her husband, and the absent Observer Star forebodes that the wife will take her own life rather than burden herself with the pain of losing her husband.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The night is gray with grapes, the wind carries rivers, blue sky vast, the bright stars shine brightly. The constellation of the北斗七星 — a dead star for北斗主, a baleful star for the south, the eight-sided glass well — a missing piece from the sun, burning coal for the dragon and woe for the moon goddess. All are above their heads.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The night ended with cloudy sown grapes, the cool wind blew through the vast gold-infused sky, where green stars shone bright. The北斗七星--the bull was dead today, while the sheep were born. The vixen rose up from the south, the tusk from the north fell from the wall, and unhappy Bellamy's wife — she would be hung for lacking a block of brick, and miserable Bellamah to jump into the river....']
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The night sky is a gray grape, golden wind winds through the river, the blue sky deep as infinity, the green stars shine brightly. The勺子北斗—主死的北斗，簸箕南斗—司生的南斗，八角玻璃井——缺少一块砖，焦灼的牛郎要上吊，忧愁的织女要跳河……都在头顶悬着。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Under cover of darkness, golden winds rustle the waterways; deep blue skies contain sparkling stars; and throughout this city of canals, they seem born of bronze. The all-seeing Sun is held down by a forked star, the fated Sun does not shine, but the lucky Star does — though its handle is missing from the bottle gourd dish. The broken-up glazed jar is held up by two protruding corners; the牛郎 and the fairy are so worried about their fate that they hang their heads and prepare to die, respectively.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The night is gray grapes, winds blow through a river of gold; the blue sky is vast and deep, and green stars shine brightly. The北斗七星——the star that died by the北斗主——is a symbol of death, while the constellation of the southern zodiac——the zodiac sign of the south——is a symbol of life. The eight corner glasses — the one missing from each corner of the eight corner glasses——are a reminder of the lack of a piece of stone in the constellation of the moon, which is burning with anger. The sorrowful mother of the Virgin Mary is hanging on her head. The sorrowful wife of the Starry Messenger is floating down the river of water.

chinese: 韦小宝大喜，来不及装饭，夹起一块红烧肉便吃，虽然菜肴早已冷了，吞入饥肠，却是说不出的美味，心想：“这些饭菜不知是谁送来的。
english: Trinket was delighted, and without bothering to fill his bowl with rice, he attacked a dish of stewed meat. The food was cold, but he was hungry, and to him it was indescribably delicious. 'I wonder where they get the food from?
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Wu Xiaowang was overjoyed at this news, but he hurriedly packed up his meal, and took out a piece of red-baked meat and ate it without thinking about it for a while. Although the food had already cooled down, he swallowed it with great hunger and couldn't say what a delicious taste it was. He thought: "These dishes must have been delivered by some one."

What warmth of appetite! Trinket ladled a large piece of red-hot meat that had been kept cold in an apron-pocket and gulped it up. Although the food had been brought over from Beijing, out of ignorance he could not speak of the delicious tempers of which there was such; though perhaps he would think more about their gift the next time he sat at the table.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Wu Xiaoya was overjoyed. He didn’t have time to take a meal, so he picked up a piece of red braised pork and ate it. Although the dishes were already cold, they tasted very good because they had just been eaten. He thought to himself, "I don’t know who sent me this food."

What happiness! Trinket was so excited he didn't even think about his meal. He grabbed a slice of red sauercure to go with his rice. The cold meat was far nicer than it had been an hour earlier, and he ate it with relish. He wondered who had brought him the meal.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Wu Xiao-Bao was delighted when he saw that his meals were already cold. He took a bite out of one red meat and said, "These dishes have come from nowhere. The taste is so delicious; I don't know who gave them."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: What warmth of welcome! Trinket had already decided on a meal, but after swallowing the little parcel of cooled red meat in his mouth he no longer had much appetite, even though there seemed to be plenty of cold air in the carriage; 'I don't know who gave me that idea,' he thought. 'I can't tell you how they got hold of it, ' he added to himself. The fact was that the food hadn't been prepared by anyone—only someone from Shanghai had brought it.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Wu Xiaopang was delighted. He did not have time to take his food, so he picked up a red braised pork and ate it. Although the dishes were already cold, they tasted delicious. He thought to himself: "I do not know who sent me this food."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: What happiness! Trinket grabbed a sandwich immediately. Too bad they were all cold! Still, it was wonderful to stuff his empty stomach with such delicious food. He wondered who had prepared this wonderful meal for them?
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Wu Xiaowang was overjoyed when he heard that the food had been prepared by a person other than himself. He took a piece of red-baked meat and ate it while he was hungry. Although the dishes were cold already, his stomach was still full and he could not say what a delicious taste it was. "I don't know who gave these dishes."

chinese: 田野里早已清静无人，在那个年头里，凡能吃上口饭的庄稼人都是早早地回家，不敢恋晚，一到夜间，高粱地就成了绿林响马的世界。
english: The fields were still and deserted. During those years, any farmer who had food at home left his field before nightfall, turning the sorghum fields into a haven for bandits.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: In fields far from human habitation, where there were no men eating food, was the year of old. The people who could eat had eaten long ago, and when they returned home, they were afraid that late night would come, for their cornfield was turned into a land of loud horses and brawls.

The field was clear of people almost overnight, as that was the week when everyone could have a meal consisting of an efficiently grown crop. When to go back home became a matter of life and death; otherwise, at night the sorghum field would turn into a maze of highwaymen.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The fields were already quiet of late, when in that year a man could eat if he was not dead. At nightfall, the cornfields became the world for outlaws.
The fields were empty of people, quiet as the era required; nocturnal thuggery had taken hold of the sorghum fields.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: In fields far from human activity, where it was already quiet and nobody was eating, this year, those who could eat a good meal had already returned home by now. They were not afraid of night. In the cornfield, green cloaks and horsemen were everywhere.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The field was clear of sound activity 27 hours a day; back then every farmer on our main production基地无论有没有粮食都必须早出晚归，不敢有早晚之别，晚上高粱的夜晚就是马灯世界的。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The fields were already quiet and deserted, for this year there was no one left who could not eat a meal. At night in these fields, robbers of corn stalks became the world's noise.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The field was empty of people by that time in history; farmers who could earn a living called home to avoid evening hours when banditry was at its height.

chinese: 他想着：“兄弟们一并都有父母教训，何必我多事，反生疏了。 况且我是正出，他是庶出，饶这样看待，还有人背后谈论，还禁得辖治了他？”
english: 'We are both equally subject to our parents' control,' he would say of himself and Jia Huan. 'Why should I create a greater distance between us by trying to control him myself – especially when I am the wife's son and he is the concubine's? People already talk behind our backs, even when I do nothing. It would be ten times worse if I were to start bossing him about.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: He thought: "The brothers all have parents' lessons; why do I bother? If that were the case, we would have been good friends. And what if I am a real man, he is a peasant, and I should see things as they are, so that there would be others who talk behind his back, and still govern him?"

That's just it,' he thought. 'Both of us will have parents' advice when we reach age; but the trouble is that I am a prospective scholar, she a commoner; and since I'm only at the beginning of my studies, compared with which they are both proficient I should be punished very reasonably. If there were such people as them to talk about and do anything else like that, I should have to put mine into practice very badly. But what I must remember is that they are only men, not women; and although they may speak ill of me publicly or私下，I am sure they shall be stopped before their words reach my mouth. And besides, even if they did do me any harm, I shouldn't feel need to deal with them publicly. '
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: He thought: "My brothers will be punished by their parents as well, why should I bother? It is more likely that I would become distant if I were to take care of this matter myself. Besides, my father is the firstborn, he has no need for a second child, so it's fine with me to look after him. But how can I allow others to speak ill of him behind my back?"

Things are worse than bad in one respect: all the errors of which I might be guilty are to be shared by the rest of the clan, so that there will be no cause for feeling inferior about my own shortcomings. Besides, I am the main source from whom this blame falls, whereas the other boys can evade it because they are only庶子; whereas my being the elder is counting against me. Even if there were no忌讳， my indiscretions could not so easily get out.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: He thought: "The brothers have parents' instructions, why bother me so much? Besides I am a son of the family, he is a daughter of the family, so we can look at him from behind, and still others talk about him."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: So he began by addressing his younger brothers. 'Both of us will have a father's instructions one way or the other. If we're not careful, our relations could become distant. After all, I am a candidate, and you are a Candidate-out. There is no cause for concern if we don't treat our relations properly; yet it would be very wrong to treat them unfairly. Then there would be others against us to go back on our word with, so I think it best that we should keep our relations correctly treated.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: He thought: "Why should I be so troublesome? It would be too awkward for me. Furthermore, he is my elder brother who has a father, while I am his younger brother with no father, so how could I not look at him as someone with some authority? And then, there will be people behind my back talking about this matter, which I can't even manage."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: They have tutors to discipline them,' he thought; 'why should I go bothering about it? It would be awkward for them, and besides I am the chief one responsible, while there is always talk behind their backs and gossiping. What should I know about self-discipline?'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: He thought, "All my brothers have parents' advice; why should I be so troublesome? Besides, I am a senior citizen myself, and there is no need for me to speak ill of him. And how about what others say behind his back? Would it not be better if he was treated well?"

chinese: 父亲怔怔地看着爷爷。 父亲的双眼大睁，从那两粒钻石一样的瞳孔里，散射出本来属于我奶奶的那种英勇无畏、狂放不羁的响马精神，那种黑暗王国里的希望之光，照亮了我爷爷的心头。
english: Father stared wide-eyed and fearfully at Granddad. The glare in his diamondlike pupils embodied the heroic, unrestrained spirit of Grandma, a flicker of hope that shone and lit up Granddad's heart.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The father looked at his aging grandfather with a puzzled expression on his face. His eyes widened as he saw the same spirit of bravery and indomitable determination that was characteristic of me, my grandmother. The light of hope that dark realms have given me, which illuminated my grandfather's heart.

Father's eyes widened with amazement. Through those two diamond-shaped eyes he saw the bold, fearless, and somewhat boisterous spirit of Grandma, lit up like a cheery cavalry man, who was shining his light on Granddad's heart.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The father stared at his grandfather with wide eyes. The two diamonds of his gaze shone from his eyes like my grandmother's brave and wild desperado spirit. That was the light of hope that had illuminated my grandfather's heart.

Father's eyes widened; there, etched in his forehead, were the large diamonds of Grandma's eyes—a look from a woman who, like Pocky Cheng, had fallen for a man too young for her. Like them, he was now living in a hope-filled, brash, uninhibited world that nobody could defeat.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The father looked at his grandfather as if he had never seen him before. His eyes were wide with the same bravery and indomitable spirit that I had once known from my grandmother, a kind of hope that was shining through his heart.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Father's eyes grew wide with amazement. Through the two diamond eyes of dawn he scanned a horde of bold, unbridled spirits, like those of Grandma, whose light-bulb had illuminated grandfather's heart.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The father stared at his grandfather with wide eyes. The two diamond-shaped pupils radiated the heroic courage and wildness of my grandmother's spirit, which was the hope for the dark kingdom. It illuminated my grandfather's heart.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Father's eyes widened; then two of those strange beads of water glinted in his eyes, identical in appearance to the beautiful but cruel womanly passion that had inspired Granddad to become a bandit as a boy. When he saw that light, Granddad's heart lit up.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: His eyes fluttered open as he watched his grandfather. His eyes were wide with a spirit of bravery, unrestrained, and boldness that is characteristic of my grandmother's wild, unquenchable spirit. The light of hope in the dark kingdom shone through him.

chinese: 因见上面大旨不过谈情，亦只是实录其事，绝无伤时诲淫之病，方从头至尾抄写回来，闻世传奇。
english: He could see that its main theme was love; that it consisted quite simply of a true record of real events; and that it was entirely free from any tendency to deprave and corrupt. He therefore copied it all out from beginning to end and took it back with him to look for a publisher.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Because it seems that there is no harm in merely recounting the matter as if it were a piece of news, and no damage to the spirit of love. Only after reading through its entirety should one copy back this text. It is from the beginning to the end.

But before his eyes could be been proved right, by a hidden message containing a number of cryptic words which seemed to speak of some secret and unsuspected objective, but which nevertheless imparted an intrinsic truthfulness, the original writer confesses without pretence any matter pertaining to love and lust, both above suspicion (for fear of复敌) and below law (for fear of punishment), and sets out what he has captured in an account so far as possible straight to the reader; but not a single word is profanity. The tale has therefore found its place in the annals of legend.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The above is just a discussion about love, which is merely a factual account of events, and there is no disease of indulging in sex or discussing immoral topics, so it has been copied from beginning to end."

It is because your last message came straight from the heart, so thoroughly revised it contains not a word of scandalous or lustful matter that we have transcribed it from start to finish and published it as a new kind of romance.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: As for the principle of the present document, it is merely a record of its facts without any symptoms of infidelity or corruption. Therefore, I will not repeat this entire work in full back to you. What about the legends from the past?
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: From this we perceive that, though no consideration for sex or proflie has been featured in the letter, all that follows is a true account of what happened. The story is already copied from above. I heard of this copy-writing from a man who did it for a newsagent at an early stage.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Because what is written above is merely a discussion of love, it is purely factual record, there is no disease of teaching lustful behavior, so I copied it from the beginning to the end, and heard the world's legend.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Everything that appears in this book is genuine. I have merely added the introduction and finale to make it a complete story. unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: In view of the grand principle that it is not about sex, nor merely a record of facts, there is no harm in treating time and love as two sides of the same coin, and writing all over again from beginning to end, so as to hear the legends of the world.

english: Having all this while had time to collect herself, Grannie Liu began her speech again: 'The real reason I have brought your little nephew here today is because his Pa and Ma haven't anything in the house to eat, and the weather is getting colder, and – and – I thought I'd bring him here to see you...'

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Grannie Liu took her leave of them all and set about making preparations to carry away her niece. 'I'm bringing you here simply to escape the cold,' she said. english: The four of them depended on agriculture for their living, and since, with Gou-er himself busy most of the day on the land and his wife busy about the farm drawing water, pounding grain, and the like, there was no one to look after Qing-er and her little brother, Gou-er invited his mother-in-law, old Grannie Liu, to come and live with them.

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: For four generations they had been farming, but since Bao-yu now made fun of his own rights even outside the farm, Grandmother Liu had to look after herself at night, and since her maid-calling business was managed by someone else, dog-life wasn't their thing, Jia Rong's brother, it was无人照顾。 So they had brought Grandma Liu home to live there, where she lived out the day and died later on.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: A family of four. They farm as their livelihood. Because the dog takes care of some daily chores during the day, Liu’s wife also does the same things like milking and grinding. Her two younger sisters could not be taken care of because they had no one to look after them. So the dog took his mother-in-law, Liu Old Old, from her home and brought her to live with them.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The Kongs were a family of four. One member of the household was a dog-driver by day who did odd jobs for someone in the neighbourhood; while his two daughters helped to bore corn and other crops. Since Gou-er had left home to seek his own livelihood, Aunt Liu (Grannie Liu) and the two girls had been living entirely at home with no one to look after them besides; so Gou-er took advantage of this lack to bring her there and share their lives.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: A family of four, working as farmers. The dog did some work during the day, so that Mr. Liu handled the water jigger and other matters. There was no one to look after the two little sisters, and the dog then took the old mother Cui Xiujiu to live.

chinese: 我抬举起你来，这会子我来了，你大模厮样儿的躺在炕上，见了我也不理一理儿。

chinese: 她订了一份晚报，黄昏时间是看报度过的，报上的每一个字她都读到，懂一半，不懂一半，半懂不懂之间，晚饭的时间便到了，炉子上的水也开了。
english: She subscribed to an evening newspaper to fill the hours of dusk. She read every word in the newspaper, making sense perhaps of half the reports. By the time she finished it, the water would be boiling and it would be dinner time.

She can read each word of every page, so half knows what they mean and half doesn't know anything. Half knew something but didn't know anything else. The water was boiling on the stove.

She got a newspaper subscription, and while she read until her eyes grew tired, she caught every word—everything. She knew half the time, but didn't know the other half; she merely had so much time that night. Dinnertime came, and the stove would turn on at least a cup of water.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: She had ordered a newspaper for her evening reading at home. She read each word aloud as she ate dinner, half understanding, half not. By the time it was time for dinner, the water on the stove had boiled.

Wang Qiyao subscribed to a local newspaper and spent her evening reading it. She understood only half of what she read, as language prints over translations were never perfect; by the time dinner time came around, the water on the stove was already boiling.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: She bought a newspaper at night and was reading it all through until she understood half of it, but not all of it. She was halfway there, then half way. unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: She got a newspaper subscription, and while she read until her eyes grew blind, she caught half the stories—nearly every story—and understood only the simplest of meanings, but occasionally things would fail to produce results—which signaled dinner time and she would need to turn off the gas.
